name: @appnest/lit-translate
author: Appnest
description: A lightweight blazing-fast internationalization (i18n) library for your next web-based project

scripts.git:add:commit:push: git add . && git commit --no-edit --amend --no-verify && git push
scripts.bump:patch: npm version patch && npm run git:add:commit:push
scripts.bump:minor: npm version minor && npm run git:add:commit:push
scripts.bump:major: npm version major && npm run git:add:commit:push
scripts.publish:patch: npm run test && npm run bump:patch && npm run b:lib && npm run publish
scripts.publish:minor: npm run test && npm run bump:minor && npm run b:lib && npm run publish
scripts.publish:major: npm run test && npm run bump:major && npm run b:lib && npm run publish

bullets: Simple API that can return a translation for a given key (out of the box you can use the dot notation eg. `get("home.header.title")`)
Works very well with JSON based translation data-structures
Can interpolate values into the strings
Customize just about everything (eg. choose your own translations loader, how to interpolate values, empty placeholder and how to look up the strings)
Caches the translations for maximum performance
Contains a `lit-html` directive that automatically updates when the language changes
